resources.string: \nThis section will help you understand the function of each button of the calculator.

CE: Clear previous entry 
C: Clear all, reset to 0 
M+: Add result to memory 
MS: Store value to memory 
MC: Clear memory 
MR: Display value in memory 

 No 0 to 9: You can enter a digit of one or several numbers 
=: Give the final result 

√: Give the square of the displayed number 
.= A number can be an integer or a decimal. In the later case, use . to create the decimal number 
SCIENTIFIC button: Switch to Scientific mode 
HELP: Open the Help section 

Be aware that this calculator is in Beta mode and cannot, for the moment, display numbers or results which are longer than 9 digits. 

Examples: 

9+3= 

9*5+8-1/2= 

23.0125*2.1= 

√25= 

2+6*9= 

2-3= followed by M+ followed by 3*3= followed by M+ followed by MR 

5+6-7 followed by CE will display 5+6- 

5+6-7 followed by CE will display 0

SCIENTIFIC SECTION

( and ): Use to place operations inside parenthesis so that calculations are performed inside before applying any other exterior operation(s). 

 For example: (5+6)-1= will give 10 as result 
x²: This will give the square of a number. For example, 5 followed by x² will give 25 
x^y: Enter a first number, press this key and enter a second number, and the second number will be the exponent of the first one. For example: 10 followed by x^y followed 2 will give 100. 
MOD : This key will give the remainder when a number is divided by another number. For example, 11 followed by MOD followed by 5 will give 1 
π: This give wil display the value of PIE and can be used for any calculation.
